title: Death Becomes You
review: Final Destination , or Flight 180 " as it was titled right up until the last minute , was a surprise hit of 2000 .

title: Death Becomes You
review: It was made with a modest budget of $ 23 m it grossed a nice sum of $ 53 m in the US .

title: Death Becomes You
review: It was in the UK , however , where the film really shone , up against the massive epic Gladiator at the time the movie managed to gross a none too bad £ 11 m but what made it better was it was a true sleeper hit , it spent 14 weeks in the UK film charts .

title: Death Becomes You
review: With no big name actors , and no major publicity the film did so well because of word of mouth and the word was it was damn good .

title: Death Becomes You
review: I admit I was sceptical at first in reading about Final Destination .

title: Death Becomes You
review: It seemed like a tired teen horror movie that seemed to be spewing out of America at that time , indeed it was only until about 3 weeks in to it being released that I actually lifted my bum off my sofa

title: Death Becomes You
review: and put my bum on the seat in front of the big screen to actually watch the movie .

title: Death Becomes You
review: I loved it , and it was made better by the low expectations I had of it . It isn"t groundbreaking

title: Death Becomes You
review: but it is effectively chilly at times , the acting is surprisingly good

title: Death Becomes You
review: and the plot is pretty fresh .

title: Death Becomes You
review: James Wong ( X Files ) came up with the idea of the movie , about cheating death ,

title: Death Becomes You
review: and it does seem to have a kind of X Files ring to it .

title: Death Becomes You
review: The story goes as follows .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Alex ( Devon Sawa ) is off , with his classmates , to France .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Now being in America France is like our version ofAmerica , so it"s a pretty big deal .

title: Death Becomes You
review: While on the plane he has a premonition of the plane exploding , slightly scared , he wakes up

title: Death Becomes You
review: and finds that some of his premonition turns out real .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Scared for his life , and the others on the plane , he cause a fuss which sees him and several other classmates chucked off the plane .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Some of his companions are none too pleaseduntil they see Flight 180 blow up , killing everyone on the plane .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Thus begins the cat and mouse chase by Death himself .

title: Death Becomes You
review: One by one , in seemingly accidental " ways , the survivors of the ill - fated crash are dying .

title: Death Becomes You
review: While others dismiss the idea of Death coming for revenge , Alex isn"t going to let it go

title: Death Becomes You
review: and soon he convinces friend Clear ( Ali Larter ) that it is up to them to try and stop Death himself .

title: Death Becomes You
review: As this happens we can witness some of the most imaginative death scenes ever .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Thanks to the movie not having a masked killer doing the rounds the death scenes are not limited to the knife in back / stomach / head / eye " routine .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Indeed , the first death scene is both funny and horrific all in one because , like with many of the deaths in this movie , it can really seem as that can actually happen .

title: Death Becomes You
review: It gives you something to think about .

title: Death Becomes You
review: The special effects , for a movie with as small as budget as this , are excellent ( apparently they did actually spend half of their budget in the SFX ) .

title: Death Becomes You
review: The plane crash is one of the most realistic you will see , its worrying to watch .

title: Death Becomes You
review: For a movie aimed at the teenager end of the market , and for a genre renowned for hammy acting , the people in this movie actually do a good job .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Devon Sawa , no stranger to movies , is perfect at playing the lead role of the troubled Alex .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Kerr Smith ( Dawson"s Creek ) does a major turnaround from what you are used to seeing him as , this time he"s the typical school jock , flash car , blonde girlfriend , bad temper ,

title: Death Becomes You
review: but luckily he doesn"t play it into overkill .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Another nice surprise is Sean William Scott ( American Pie , Road Trip , Too many teen movies ) , while we are used to seeing him as the guy who cracks jokes and makes fun of the others , he plays the geeky guy this time , and he provides us with quite a bit of comic relief .

title: Death Becomes You
review: We also have a nice cameo of Tony Todd ( aka the Candyman ) as Bludworth , who plays the man at the morgue , he is suitably chilling ,

title: Death Becomes You
review: and is set to play a larger part in the sequel .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Suspense wise this film doesn"t fail either .

title: Death Becomes You
review: In many films like this you are guessing who will be killed next .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Not so in this movie .

title: Death Becomes You
review: You are actually told who is going to meet Death next .

title: Death Becomes You
review: However this doesn"t spoil it .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Suspense is carried over by how the person will die .

title: Death Becomes You
review: If you know a person is going to die as soon as the camera pans of them , and their all alone , then your waiting in anticipation for them to die ,

title: Death Becomes You
review: but there are many false scares along the way .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Also the suspense is kept up throughout the movie , it doesn"t seem to drag too much at any time .

title: Death Becomes You
review: There are very few bad points to the movie .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Obviously it will depend on your taste whether you like it or not , whether you consider it too teeny " or too teeny

title: Death Becomes You
review: but just right anyway .

title: Death Becomes You
review: This film does have fun as well as generate scares .

title: Death Becomes You
review: It is worth noting that there is an alternate ending to the movie and quite a few deleted scenes , namely a main subplot where Clear becomes pregnant .

title: Death Becomes You
review: I think that it was wise to omit these parts , the ending seemed cheesy ,

title: Death Becomes You
review: but the one we are left with is excellent .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Final Destination , thanks to an imaginative story , nice acting and some elaborate death scenes breathes new life into the tired genre of teen horror .

title: Death Becomes You
review: It is not as widely recognized as the Scream trilogy ,

title: Death Becomes You
review: but in many respects it"s better .

title: Death Becomes You
review: Lets hope the sequel maintains the high standard it has set .

title: Death Becomes You
review: FINAL DESTINATION IS Different Nicely acted Filled with imaginative deaths FINAL DESTINATION IS NOT Low on suspense A typical teen horror Going to be shown as in - flight entertainment

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: Final Destination starts as 17 year old Alex Browning ( Devon Sawa ) & his classmates turn up at JFK airport in readiness to catch flight 180 to Paris , he boards the plane & it takes off & in midair it explodes killing everyone on - board .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: Alex them wakes up & realises it was a dream like vision , he becomes freaked out when the events which happened in his vision happen in real life & after causing a large commotion he along with several of his classmates are thrown off the plane before it takes off .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: They are left in the departure lounge as the plane takes off , then they all witness it as it blows up in mid air killing everyone aboard just like in Alex"s vision .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: Those who walked off the plane try to get on with their lives but start to die under mysterious circumstances leading Alex to believe that death has come back to claim those he saved ... Co - written & directed by James Wong I have to say I thought Final Destination when it originally came out was a breath of fresh air for the horror genre which was producing boring unimaginative teen crap for years like they were coming off on a production line , at the time I originally saw it at the cinema I genuinely thought Final Destination tried to be something that bit different

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: yet still gave horror fans what they wanted .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: The script by Wong , producer Glen Morgan & Jeffrey Reddick was apparently based on a potential The X - Files ( 1993 - 2002 ) episode & I must admit I loved the idea behind it , I thought it was clever , fun & made a great central premise for killing off teens in spectacular ways .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: The character"s are good considering their clichÃ © d American teen origins , the dialogue is good with it"s plot explained just about enough to make sense without going overboard & at less than 100 minutes it moves along like a rocket with some extremely satisfying & clever set - pieces .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: The film also has a healthy respect for the genre & there are lots of homages & references to other genre films including naming the cast after old horror stars & director"s , Valerie Lewton anyone ? Of course it"s not perfect & I"m not trying to say it is , while they are OK the character"s are just faceless teens when all said & done , the mortician character is just very out - of - place , one could say it"s a touch silly & the set - pieces go from sinister & clever acts which conspire to dispense of a character to overblown full on ghostly events like possessed electric cables , exploding cars & entire house"s blowing up & some of it"s own rules are broken as if Alex wasn"t the next victim because he never actually changed seats why did death try to kill him when he was at the cabin before Carter who was as it is revealed the next victim ? Still , I"ll leave the nit picking to the monkeys because I just thought it was a highly entertaining & pretty original teen horror flick with a good story & decent gore .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: Director Wong does a good job & the film is very stylish & great to look at although I"m coming off the back of a terrible run of zero budget shot on a digital camcorder crap that makes something that looks this good an absolute god send .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: There"s a lot of visual gags here , I loved the prevailing sense of doom at the airport with the informations boards displaying words like " departed " & " terminal " ! Plus there"s a John Denver song playing in the airport toilets & , of course , he died in a plane crash ! I was more than pleased to see the makers haven"t skipped on the gore either , there"s decapitations , hangings , embalming"s , stabbings , broken glass in necks , someone gets splattered by a bus in a great scene & there"s plenty of blood splashed around .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: The film has a nice eerie tension & has a few genuine jumpy scare moments .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: With a supposed budget of about $ 23 , 000 , 000 this is very well made , the CGI effects are decent although not perfect while the make - up effects are very good .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: The film is set in a south New York

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: but was shot in British Columbia in Canada .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: The acting is pretty good from a recognisable & good looking teenage cast , horror regular Tony Todd makes a small & somewhat pointless cameo .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: Final Destination is , in my humble opinion , one of the finest teen horror popcorn flicks this millennium & it"s as simple & straight forward as that .

title: Great teen horror flick with a nice hint of originality.
review: This proved enough of a success to spawn two sequels , the even better Final Destination 2 ( 2003 ) & Final Destination 3 ( 2006 ) .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: " Final Destination " pulls off a great trick .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: While managing to retain a commendably non-"Scream " seriousness of purpose , a solemn accretion of suspense , a faithfulness to genuine fears and emotions , the multiple deaths in the film are as blackly funny as they are elaborately gruesome ;

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: but this note of the comic in an otherwise grimly portentous movie , never betrays its ambitions .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: These ARE some deaths , though ; some intolerably protracted , implausibly set up , yet deliciously executed ; others sharp , horrifying , hilarious shocks , one of which suggest the scriptwriters must have seen Lynne - Maree Danzay"s brilliant short " Fetch " , where autobuses are used to similar effect .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: With films like " The Sixth Sense " and " X - Men " , it looks like Surrealism , once mocked as a dotty , marginal movement , has finally pervaded the Hollywood mainstream .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: Not only does most of the action take place at night ,

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: but there is also an early suggestion that the whole thing is dreamt by Alex , not just the first plane crash - as he falls asleep on the eve of the trip , the clock showing 1 : 00 fades into the 180 that is the number of the plane ; the dissolve is drawn attention to , signalling a move into the dream or imagined that the film never comes out of .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: The narrative , therefore , becomes an expanded Unconscious , a drama of a whole set of fears .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: It is appropriate that Alex is 17 , on the brink of adulthood - his dad dolefully suggests that his whole life is ahead of him , as if freedom , youth , fun are all at an end . And they are .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: As all fears are often sexual in basis , it is appropriate that Alex doesn"t reach the final destination of the title at first - the plane crash is a coitus interruptus , like the bomb that stops the kiss in " Touch of Evil " ; it is a stunting of growth , a refusal to move into adulthood , to progress sexually ( Paris , of course , being the stereotypical city of love ) .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: As his friends are either trying to get off with girls , or are lucky enough to have one , Alex remains a solitary figure , locked into his own mind , whose only sexual relief is an old copy of Penthouse .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: Whereas the teen movie , for all its modish trappings , is generally conservative , concerned with finding a mate , fitting in , asserting order , like a Shakespearean comedy , setting the continuity of the species in motion , Alex is a destructive force , linked to death ( the scrappaper with Tod written on it , as well as alluding to his friend , also refers to the German word for death ) , sterility ; we are never quite convinced that the events are out of his control .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: In one brilliant sequence of cross - cutting , Alex"s opening of his Penthouse is linked with the leak of Tod"s toilet , setting in motion his friend"s death , Alex"s onanistic seed a murderous power .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: As the film proceeds , he becomes increasingly detached from community , from reality , setting himself up as a godlike power , imposing patterns on the randomness of life , right down to the obscurely arrogant climactic gesture of self - sacrifice .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: Even when order seems to be asserted at the end , he has finally reached Paris ,

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: and he has a relationship with a woman , has joined the status quo , he is unable to deal with it , he has to destroy it .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: Like Melville"s " Le Samourai " , " Destination " is a dream of masculine selfhood , of wholeness , of the fears that it will be diluted , fragmented , by compromise , society , difference .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: As a study in heightened megalomania , " Destination " reaches heights from modest ambitions unavailable to the risible pretentions of the " Beach " .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: The Surrealist aesthetic also informs the film"s treatment of suspense , a steady accretion of " normal " , familiar , domestic details , imbued with the terror of a diseased mind - the opening airport sequences are a masterpiece of anticipatory dread , the everyday made malevolent .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: The unsensational revelation of the plane explosion , a mere firework , in the background as boys fight , is staggeringly , resonantly beautiful , sequences such as the tasteless memorial to the air - crash victims - a statue of an eagle ! - suggest that Surrealism , as Breton said of the English , is less a view of the world than a way of life .

title: Surrealist suspense(spoilers)
review: For some reason films like this and " The Faculty " are treated with hostility and indifference by critics .

title: Yet another "humans are cogs in a giant wheel" movie
review: Can the world stand one more of these movies ? Whatever happened to the idea of free will , or that things happen by accident , or that you can never really plan anything -- stuff just happens for no reason ? Are we really living in a time where people are so scared of world events that they want to believe we are all part of some gigantic plan ? Why are movies about predestination being made , the idea is as old and outdated as bloodletting , the miracle cure .

How do Alex and his chums know so exactly where and how they can get into the morgue at night ? Why does Alex repeatedly almost die when sheltering in a wood cabin ,

title: Mildly entertaining, but silly and inconsistent
review: and why does the strange wind that presages a death blow through the cabin , even though Alex figures out a minute later that it isn"t actually his turn yet ? How come the three survivors eventually go on for six months without trouble , even though it turns out they are still scheduled to die ? Did Death need a break ? ? I don"t even care to wonder about the psychology of the characters , who are able to deal with one friend"s gruesome death after another without shedding a single tear .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: The word " original " gets thrown around a lot in film criticism but " Final Destination " is a truly original and devilishly inventive horror film .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: It is clever and unusual and the young cast is likable and play their roles well .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: Seated upon a plane which is about to take off for Paris , France , young Alex Browning ( Devon Sawa ) has a terrifying premonition in which he and his group of fellow students and teachers are killed when the plane explodes shortly after takeoff .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: Understandably , he flips out , and his resulting panic causes him and a small group of his friends and one of their teachers to be thrown off the flight .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: Mere minutes later , they watch in horror , shock , and disbelief , as Alex"s premonition comes true and the plane does , indeed , explode .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: But , it turns out that they are not quite so lucky as they think .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: They soon learn that Death will not be cheated of their lives so easily and before long that terrible spectre is hunting them down , one by one , and killing them in a series of what appear to be bizarre accidents .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: Can Alex figure out Death"s design before it is too late ? The deaths in this film are cleverly put together

title: 'And When I Die'
review: and staged , and quite violent at times .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: There is a macabre kind of fun to be had in trying to figure out who will be next to fall beneath Death"s merciless scythe .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: Another really neat thing about this film is that most of the main characters have surnames which reference great classic horror actors , directors , and producers .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: This is a really nice touch .

title: 'And When I Die'
review: " Final Destination " is intelligently written

title: 'And When I Die'

title: 'And When I Die'

review: and they always kick off with an exceptionally well - staged catastrophe which sets the scene for what is to follow .

title: 'And When I Die'

I had seen FD3 and 4 and I really liked them so I thought I"d see the first one .
I liked it but I didn"t think it was as good as the them .
I thought the plane crash was a good idea , as it plays on most people"s fears about flying
and there were some good actors .
I thought that the deaths were OK
but not as inventive as some of the others .
I"ll be honest , before seeing this I thought that it would be way more gory than it actually was .
I wo nt deny it did make my toes curl when billy got half his head cut off
but that was the only one I thought was particularly bad .
Overall I would say that Final Destination is a good film with some good scenes . I would rate it 8 .
5/10 and say that it is suitable for anyone 13 +

review: A student named Alex Browning ( Devon Sawa ) has a dream about a plane that he and his french class are on exploding in mid air .

review: When he wakes up , things start happening just as they had in the dream .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: Alex freaks out , and is removed from the plane , along with five other classmates and a teacher .

review: As these seven are grounded , their classmates are Paris bound ,

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: and everyone is mad at Alex for disrupting their plans .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: But lo and behold , as the seven ( and the audience ) watch in horror , the plane they have just left explodes shortly after takeoff .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: The rest of the story is like this : they cheated death .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: Now death has to come back and finished what he started .

review: Now that I"ve set you all up , here is my personal review .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: In one word : WOW ! ! .

review: Sure the plot may sound a bit cheesy ,

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: but believe me , this film is one heck of a roller coaster ride .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: The first twenty minutes will hold you breathless as you await the inevitable plane crash .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: After that happens , the film sustains the gloom created from the disaster , adding creepiness to the mix because you never know what"s going to happen next .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: Who will die next ? And how ? The movie hints at how the people will die ,

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: but it"s not until after the fact that you say " oh , so THAT"S what they meant by that image ! " Speaking of images , this movie is filled with images you won"t get out of your head for a while .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: The horrific plane explosion is just one of many .

review: The writing is such that you actually care for these characters , so when one of them dies , you feel a sense of shock and sadness .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: and some of the lines are corny , it"s a wonderfully terrifying film that , on more that one occasion , made me jump out of my seat more that any film has in a LONG LONG time .

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: The story is an interesting idea that could have easily become a terrible B - movie ,

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!

title: GO EXPERIENCE THIS FILM!!!
review: but be engrossed by it .

title: Final Desparation
review: I have to disagree with the positive reviews .

title: Final Desparation
review: The truth is that Final Destination is irredeemably bad and isn"t even comparable to the pretty average Urban Legend , let alone the wonderful Scream trilogy .

title: Final Desparation
review: Final Destination , like Scream and its imitators , has people dying in a variety of gory ways that make people laugh ; unlike Scream , it doesn"t seem to be in on the joke that people are laughing because they"re so badly executed .

title: Final Desparation
review: Let"s be honest : there"s barely a plot , there"s no humour and the special effects are pretty unremarkable .

title: Final Desparation
review: The cast is absolutely minimally talented ( the guy from Dawson"s Creek can"t even convincingly play a one - dimensional character ) and there"s no attempt at character development .

title: Final Desparation
review: Plot holes are legion : if Clear Rivers"s parents are both dead , who"s been her legal guardian through school -

title: Final Desparation
review: and whose stuff is it that"s all through her house in the background ? At no point in the film do you seel sympathy for or interest in any of the characters .

title: Final Desparation
review: Go and rent Scream again instead - even if you"re already seen it a thousand times , it"ll still be more satisfying than this vapid tosh .

title: Death's Predestination
review: " Final Destination " is a riff on the Christian concept of predestination - the idea that God infallibly guides those who are destined for salvation .

title: Death's Predestination
review: In this film the idea is that all persons are infallibly predestined to die at a certain time in their life .

title: Death's Predestination
review: The movie starts out promisingly .

title: Death's Predestination
review: A planeload of high school students and advisors are headed to Paris for a senior trip .

title: Death's Predestination
review: While waiting for the plane to take off , one of the students has some premonitions that they are going to crash .

title: Death's Predestination
review: He causes a commotion , and as a result six of the students

title: Death's Predestination
review: and one advisor are kicked off the plane .

title: Death's Predestination
review: Then they watch in horror as the plane explodes after takeoff .

title: Death's Predestination
review: Most people who don"t die in a plane crash go through survivor"s guilt .

title: Death's Predestination
review: But because they have cheated death , the seven survivors here must instead dodge all sorts of deadly mishaps .

title: Death's Predestination
review: " Final Destination " doesn"t know whether to take itself seriously or not .

title: Death's Predestination
review: Unlike the characters in " Scream , " who discuss horror film references while trying to dodge various slashers , the characters in " Final Destination " are not given a humorous moment .

title: Death's Predestination
review: " Final Destination " writers Jeffrey Reddick and Glen Morgan do name most of their characters after horror movie staples : Browning ( after Tod Browning of " Dracula " and " Freaks " fame ) , Val Lewton ( after the director of " Cat People " ) Shreck ( after Max Shreck , star of " Nosferatu " ) Hitchcock , Chaney , and so on .

title: Death's Predestination
review: But my guess is the young people the film is targeting won"t make the connection .

title: Death's Predestination
review: It"s hard to tell if whatever humor the movie has is intentional or not .

title: Death's Predestination
review: When death targets the characters , so many bad things happen at once that I was reminded of the character in " Li"l Abner " who walked around under a cloud .

title: Death's Predestination
review: The main character keeps hearing the song " Rocky Mountain High " ( because John Denver died in a plane crash ) before someone is about to die ,

title: Death's Predestination
review: but at the end of the song is being played by a Paris street musician - not likely .

review: What if Death had a plan for you ,

title: Your destination for fun...

title: Your destination for fun...

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Hopelessness , the state of giving up in believing anything will happen in accordance to one"s expectation , is an essential emotion that must be elicited in the genre of horror movies .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Despite its importance , many horror movies fail to deliver this fundamental element effectively because it is often limited to only a few scenes or characters .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: On the other hand , horror movies that can sustain the feeling of hopelessness from the beginning to the end among all characters in a convincible manner will stand out the most , instilling the minds of many audience permanently .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Among all , Final Destination is an outstanding example .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Final destination , both the title and the grand metaphor used to deliver the essence of the movie , is a referral to the last stage of our lives - death .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: While death has haunted us since the moment that we are conscious of our own existence , Final destination takes a step further

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: and draw our fears not only from death itself ,

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: but from the hopelessness that stems from the absence of a second life and the inevitability nature of death .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: The absence of a second lifeIf final destination is the grand metaphor for death itself , then the movie implies that there is nothing beyond death as it is the final stage of our lives .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Indeed , the existence of a second life is questioned in the movie , as Alex looks up into the sky

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: and asks " Are they up there ? Somehow ... Is 180 still in flight ? Somewhere ... Are they still safe ? " .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: This suggests that Alex tends to believe that a second life does exist where deceased individuals can acquire a second chance

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: and reverse the decisions that they have made from their former lives .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Interestingly , Clear agrees with Alex as she says , " It exists , that place ... A place where me and my dad and my mom ... Are still together ....

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: And have no idea about this second life , here .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: " While the sentiments that they have expressed are laudable , the absence of any involvement from the deceased characters harshly demonstrates that the so - called " second life " only exists in their imagination , or more importantly , only in the audience"s mind , thus drowning the audience in hopelessness .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: The inevitability nature of deathAlthough the absence of a second life is seemingly depressing , the possibility of escaping from death instantly illuminates the morbid situation .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: Similar to the audience , the survivors in the movie summon every ounce of their courage in an attempt to escape their own death and control their fates .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: However , they have failed , and along with their failure , is the delivery of the message that death itself is inevitable , thereby extinguishing the last ray of hope in both the characters "

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: and audience"s mind .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: While death has haunted humanity since the beginning of time , Final Destination successfully magnifies this fear conceptually by emphasizing its inevitability and eradicating the possibility of a second life .

title: Final Destination - a conceptually winning horror movie that delivers fear from hopelessness
review: This pushes us into an abyss of hopelessness , where we now terrifyingly question , what if an afterlife does not exist ? What if death is indeed our final destination ?

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: It"s surprising that the first film in a long running series still remains one of the most beloved as , in a series known for high amounts of gore , the death scenes in the film seem a little less memorable in comparison .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: However , Final destination delivers on all of the campy thrills we have come to expect from teen horror movies ,

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: and it does so in a marvelously original fashion .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: What has now become an iconic plotline with horror fans , the film follows a group of high school students who escape death after one of them has a premonition of a plane crash .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: Inspired loosely by the real life story of a real life story in which a woman avoided death because of a gut feeling she shouldn"t get on a plane , the movie manages to grasp at some genuine tension in it"s earliest moments .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: As the film progresses , it begins to devolve into a more campy sense of dread , as you begin to await the deaths of the remaining teens .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: Devon Sawa turns in a capable performance as the lead ,

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: and he is backed up sufficiently by the supporting cast , including Ali Larter , Kerr Smith , and Kristen Cloke .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: The writing present here is solid ,

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: and the story provides us with a solid group of characters .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: Even despite some initial friction with some of them , you never really want to see any of them bite the dust ,

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: and as a result , watching death slowly approach them grasps a true sense of dread .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: The film is relatively old , as next year it will be coming up on it"s 20th birthday .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: And while , you never fully expect the effects to look as good as a modern day film , the effects present here still leave much to be desired .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: However that is easily forgivable due to the amount of originality present in this now treasured movie .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: Regardless of the dated effects , it is impressive that a film , generally dismissed by critics of the time , has spawned a series that has cemented itself into the horror canon as well as this one has .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: The crown jewel of this movie is the now iconic bus death .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: Providing us with one of the more shocking deaths in a horror film .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: The impact this film has had on the horror genre is hard to ignore ,

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: and as a result the dated feel of the film is extremely easy to forgive .

title: Original, if Slightly Dated, Thriller
review: The film is as tense as it is entertaining , lending itself to be a film that will be watched and re - watched throughout future generations .

review: Having foreseen the impending explosion of a plane

title: Foresight
review: and saved his friends " lives , a teenager becomes convinced that they accidentally cheated death

review: and that a grim fate still awaits them in this slick horror - thriller .

title: Foresight
review: While similar to Thom Eberhardt"s " Sole Survivor " , this latter film is still blessed with a fairly original premise and there are several intense moments to be had as the teens try to avoid Death coming for them after two of the surviving friends die in mysterious circumstances .

title: Foresight
review: The premise does , however , offer far more questions than answers , such as why Devon Sawa"s character is sometimes able to foresee what will happen , why Death takes so long to come after them again ,

review: and most strikingly , why almost all of the deaths are elaborate and over - the - top .

title: Foresight

title: Foresight
review: The early moments of Sawa"s hyper - awareness pre - flight are very well done

title: Foresight
review: and the camera hardly ever sits still throughout , often gliding

title: Foresight
review: and sweeping over the characters in a creepy manner .

title: Foresight
review: The film additionally deserves some credit for ending on a darkly comic laugh for what it is otherwise a rather grim take on fate and predestination .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: " X - Files " veterans Glen Morgan and James Wong do well with this better than average , interesting horror movie .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: It"s not wholly original - a little known movie titled " Sole Survivor " predates it by about 17 years ,

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: and its succession of elaborate murder set pieces calls to mind the " Omen " series - but it"s slick and entertaining .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: Its premise hinges on the idea that Death has a " design " ; people can interfere with that design

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: but are merely delaying the inevitable .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: Devon Sawa stars as Alex Browning , about to fly to Paris with his high school French class , only to experience a horrific vision of the airplane exploding .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: He and several others get off the airplane , which does indeed explode .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: However , the survivors won"t have long to celebrate their good fortune as Death intends to claim them no matter what .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: Alex figures out the order in which they will perish and starts doing everything he can to intervene .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: The story becomes rather standard stuff as we watch our cast of characters get knocked off one at a time ,

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: and the brutality visited upon this unfortunate bunch is often extremely amusing , whether it involves stabbing , fire , decapitation , or being mowed down by a bus .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: Things get off to a moody , atmospheric , and ominous start with some well done opening credits

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: and the viewer does get a sense of impending doom right away .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: One of the best touches is turning John Denver"s song " Rocky Mountain High " ( the late singer having perished in a plane crash himself ) into a harbinger of death .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: The material is sincerely played by its cast , also including Ali Larter ( " Heroes " ) , Kerr Smith ( " Dawson"s Creek " ) , Seann William " Stifler " Scott ( " Goon " ) , Chad Donella ( " Disturbing Behavior " ) , Daniel Roebuck ( " Halloween II " " 09 ) , Brendan Fehr ( " The Forsaken " ) , etc .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: The sequence with charismatic genre veteran Tony Todd as enigmatic mortician Mr. Bludworth is far and away the best , with Todd making the most of his brief screen time .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: Pacing is good , the special effects mostly convincing , and all in all the movie makes for a good diversion , although it eventually gets bogged down in the whole idea of just what the order of death should be ,

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: and the ending is just not terribly satisfactory .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: Still , filmmakers have certainly gotten a lot of mileage out of the concept here , with three sequels and one prequel having followed this initial entry .

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: This is fun enough material with a lot of shocks , a bit of self - referential flavour to the writing ( characters are named after notable filmmakers and actors of the 1920"s , 30"s , and 40"s ) ,

title: Death sure likes to keep busy...
review: and a fair amount of style . Seven out of 10 .

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube
review: I see strong resemblance in these FD films to the old B&W Carnival Of Souls film , where death is literally the entity catching up with someone , an ethereal woman , who mistakenly lived after an accident and is creating ripples of unrest in reality by surviving .

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube
review: Highly recommended - I have the DVD , Carnival Of Souls is now considered a sort of lost classic .

review: I like the cheesy organ score , done one finger style on a cheap carnival organ by the director himself .

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube
review: The Final Destination films have an interesting Rube Goldberg way of unfolding events , that is simple minded and amusing amidst the faux - philosophical conversations the otherwise clueless teens are engaging in .

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube
review: Each death is like the old Mousetrap game , obvious the moment the ball starts rolling down the chute , while the teens try to act like it"s Rubik"s cube unfathomable !

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube
review: And gawd do I laff at that old coroner who suddenly hands them the answers to the universe between burning bodies , whenever they think to ask him ( which has only been twice in two films , whereas you"d think they"d be sitting at his feet trying to pick the mystical genius " brain 24 - 7 ! Makes no sense , and is just tossed in as a way to " explain " what death is doing , and it"s done so shamelessly cheesy that I like it ! ) I take the FD films as a humorous twist on Carnival Of Souls

review: and enjoy them as such .

review: The teen actors themselves are all blah cyphers , meaningless and interchangeable other than Bangs herself ,

title: More Rube Goldberg than Rubik's Cube
review: but the writing and situations are cool , especially the surreal dialogue at the most inappropriate times ( I died laffing when , seconds after seeing their friend sliced in two next to the railroad track and his blood still dripping off them , the kid starts lecturing Bangs about his newest intricate theory of the progression of deaths , even before they start running away from the approaching sirens ! ! ) .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: What really had me going about Final Destination was not the terrifying and gory deaths , or the the non - stop entertainment plot , or even the most original and frightening beginning since Scream .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: What really got me to enjoy this movie was the completely new idea of the " slasher movie without the slasher " idea , the magnificently shot scenes which kept you so freaked out about what was going to happen , the freaky and eerie score , and the amazingly fresh plot .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: After three years of lame and predictable slasher movies ( with the exception of the well done Scream movies ) , Final Destination gives us a totally new look on death .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: Has there ever been any way of death in movies that aren"t murders , accidents , or suicides ? Final Destination gives us something new : the form of death itself gets cheated by five teenagers who get removed from a plane which explodes in mid - air .

review: They were supposed to die with the rest of the passangers .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: Now Death is mad , and it decides to kill off the teenagers one - by - one to balance things out , using accidents and framed suicides to hide the fact that death is on a rampage of revenge .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: As each character dies throughout the story , the main character Alex , who can somehow see the deaths before they happen , looks desperately

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: and tries to find Death"s pattern of killing , because if he finds that , they can cheat death again .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: This movie has some problems , like the scene with the mortician ,

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: but because of the fresh story , the superb death scenes , the fine acting , and the very eerie feeling you get while watching the movie , you hardly even notice them .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.
review: The movie also has great comedy in it , something only the Scream movies have perfected .

title: An Original and Entertaining Film.

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: It"s hard to explain exactly what I think of this film .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: If it can be placed under the category of teen slasher horror type flick ( along with the " Scream " trilogy , " I Know What You Did Last Summer , " " Urban Legends , " and " The Faculty " ) , then I"d have to admit it performed very well .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: Otherwise , if that is not what you are looking for , then just don"t see it .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: However , " Final Destination " gives a new twist to the genre ( introduced by the tag line " You can"t cheat death " ) by attacking and terrorizing the characters with a killer that absolutely can not be killed ( or stopped , as you will see in the end ) .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: And since the killer is not really human , the deaths don"t necessarily have to be realistic ( anything short of completely unbelievable is an understatement ) , which is actually somewhat refreshing ; it forces you to kind of use your imagination ;

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: and if you can"t , it provides the pretty ( read : gory and bloody ) pictures for you .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: The main principles by which the characters follow regarding " Death"s Design " was reminiscent of John Calvin"s belief of predestination which ignited during the Protestant Reformation .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: This belief was that God decided in advance who lives and who dies .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: The movie reconstructs this idea very well ,

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: and even leaves you wondering whether they were right about Death"s Design or whether they were just following the plan all along .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: Other than all that , the film proves exciting through the end ( you will NOT be bored ) , because as we all know , Death is relentless .

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: People may complain about the ridiculous dialogue ( which it has ,

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: but that"s not what this genre is popular for ) or about the idiotic actions of characters ( which they are ,

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: but that is all too common and expected in slasher films ) , or the supernatural causes of death ( which is what will make this movie memorable longer than Scream ) , but overall it does exactly what movies of this genre are supposed to do : scare you -- scare you because you don"t know who"s going to die ,

title: Boy vs. Death...free will against destined fate...hmmm
review: and scare you even more if you do .

title: It's not big & it's not clever
review: For instance , one of the students is in the bathroom ; spooky music starts up ; he"s sitting on the loo ( ouch ) ; a tap underneath comes loose by itself & water drips out ; he gets up from the loo ( phew ) ; he sees a shadow in the mirror ; he picks up a razor & cuts himself on the neck ; the water moves purposefully towards his bare feet ; NO , he"s put down the razor & walks away just before the water touches his feet ; he plugs in a radio ( water , electricity ouch ) ; again he moves just before the water reaches him ; etc . , etc .

review: This sort of voyeuristically sadistic who"s going to get it next & how " game , although basically in very bad taste , can be very funny : for instance in Scream " .

title: It's not big & it's not clever
review: The difference is that Scream " is clever enough to make it obvious that the characters being bumped off in increasingly messy ways were parodies of themselves & not meant to be taken seriously ; here however it seems we"re supposed to believe that they are real .

title: It's not big & it's not clever
review: In expecting us to take sadistic delight in guessing who gets it next & in what particularly grisly manner I think makes a movie like this just plain nasty , & childishly so .

title: It's not big & it's not clever
review: At the risk of getting a touch of the Mary Whitehouses ( God forbid ) I think it is exactly this sort of movie which contributes to making society , ( particularly American society & with it the rest of the Western world ) , numb to pain , suffering & violence in a way that immunises us from the real thing : so that the war in the Gulf , the Kosovan crisis , become just another TV show - & we forget that there are real people out there suffering & dying horribly , or maybe we just don"t care .

title: It's not big & it's not clever
review: OK end of sermon ! I said we"re supposed to believe the characters are real supposed " because they are badly realised , & mostly caricatures : either shallow & nasty , stupid or plain dull .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: James Wong , director of the hit television series " X - Files " , steps inside the teen - horror genre with this intriguing disaster - thriller .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: Alex Browning ( played by Devon Sawa ) , a high school senior is on his way on a week - long field trip with his French class to Paris .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: Shortly upon boarding the plane , Alex has a horrifying vision of the plane exploding .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: Plagued with paranoia , Alex panics and rushes off the plane , with seven others removed off board .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: Much to everyone"s shock , Alex"s nightmare comes true when the plane unexpectedly explodes upon takeoff , killing everyone on board .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: The survivors off board include Alex"s best friend Todd ( Chad E. Donella ) , his arch - rival Carter ( Kerr Smith ) , Carter"s girlfriend Terri ( Amanda Detmer ) , orphaned girl Clear ( Ali Larter ) , tag - along student Billy ( Seann William Scott ) , and their teacher Mrs. Lewton ( Kristen Cloke ) .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: While many become grief- stricken by their losses , Alex discovers that death is still after them when the survivors who originally escaped their demise begin dying in freak accidents .

title: An intriguing teen horror-thriller
review: Final Destination was definitely one of the most original horror films Hollywood has it offer .

title: Nothing is certain but death and sequels.
review: Final Destination sees a group of students narrowly avoid being blown to smithereens in an airplane disaster after one of their number , Alex ( Devon Sawa ) , witnesses the catastrophe in a vision minutes before it actually happens .

review: Miffed at being cheated , Death decides to have another pop at each of the survivors , claiming them in the order they would have died in the midair explosion .

title: Nothing is certain but death and sequels.
review: This simple yet ingenious concept allows director James Wong to deliver a series of intricately designed and wonderfully imaginative death set - pieces that make this film one of the most genuinely entertaining and original horrors of the decade ; not since The Omen films has violent death been so imaginatively planned

review: and it is pretty social outcast Clear ( the lovely Ali Larter from Heroes ) who is next up for the chop ... With spectacularly gory deaths , a very likable and talented young cast , a dark sense of humour , a cool cameo from Tony " Candyman " Todd , and a totally unique killer , Final Destination goes to prove that not all big budget , major - studio , teen - orientated horror is totally worthless garbage .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: * Final SPOILERS * Teenager Alexander " Alex " Browning ( Devon Sawa , " Idle Hands " ) is about to fly to France on Flight 180 ,

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: but a few seconds after boarding he has the terrifying vision of the plane having a terrible accident and killing everyone on board .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: He is about to dismiss it as a bad dream , when everything that happened at the beginning of the " dream " does indeed happen , and understandably freaks out , getting himself and some peers - best friend Tod Waggner ( Chad E. Donella , " The X - Files " ) , jock jerk Carter Horton ( Kerr Smith , " Dawson"s Creek " ) and his girlfriend Terry Chaney ( Amanda Detmer , " What About Brian " ) , goof Billy Hitchcock ( Seann William Scott , " American Pie " ) , distraught teacher Valerie Lewton ( Kristen Cloke , " MillenniuM " ) and mysterious loner Clear Rivers ( Ali Larter , " Heroes " ) - off the plane .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: The crash happens , and the feelings of everyone , including Alex himself , are mixed .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: But the worst is yet to come ... They weren"t meant to get off the plane ,

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: and Death begins to reclaim its dues .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: But Alex seems to have the gift ( or curse ) to be able to notice clues about who is going to die and how ,

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: and finds out that Death is following a plan , an order , in killing them off ... An instant classic of the horror genre , " Final Destination " , based on the 1999 crash of TWA Flight 800 , has been a huge ( and deserved ) success , for the audience if not critically , getting two sequels ( and a third , which is rumored to come out in 2009 ) and lots of fans .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: And with good reason ; this story manages to create suspense and terror without the usual knife - wielding maniac , melds together the supernatural and the " 10 Little Indians " kind of movie with great results , putting successfully even a touch of humor in it ,

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: and raise thought - provoking questions about Life and Death without being bogged down into Bergmanisms .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: Plus , it has , rare occasion in the horror genre , a leading man .

title: A breath of new life into the 'dying' horror genre
review: So , more power to it ! Final Destination : 10/10 .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: It is refreshing to see a film that innovates .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: The last film to do that in the horror genre was ` Scream " .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: ` Final Destination " has introduced an inventive approach to the genre , giving it a supernatural killer rather than a lunatic slasher dress up in some kind of costume .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: Using ` Death " as the killer opens up myriad possibilities for the method of death and choice of victims .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: This film was excellent at presenting the supernatural stalker"s manipulation of the physical world to find murder weapons in everyday objects .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: While the concept of Death taking people from earth is hardly new in films , the idea of Death as a malevolent attacker that has a plan that can be outwitted is a novelty .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: This film is the germination of an interesting direction ,

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: but does not bring the concept to maturation .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: It is unsophisticated in its storytelling and the characters lack subtlety and realism in their reactions to their situation .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: They are undifferentiated from their hollow horror counterparts in that regard , just fodder for the beast .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: Director James Wong , who has mostly TV credits on his resume , breaks into feature films with a vengeance .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: From the standpoint of the photography and visual effects , the film was excellent .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: His camera perspectives were creative and lent greater force to the suspense .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: His crafting of the scenes was less effective .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: The prescient clues to the next murder lacked nuance .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: There were no surprises except perhaps the last murder .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: The formula was always the same , Alex predicts a murder

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: and then rushes frantically to prevent it with mixed results .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: As is often the case in this genre , the acting had a broad range from terrible to very good .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: Devon Sawa was excellent .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: He gave his character much more range and depth than we are used to seeing from horror heroes .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: He was the closest to having genuine human responses to the tragedies , at least in the beginning of the film .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: Ali Larter was good as Clear ,

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: but her character didn"t have much range and she did little to expand the envelope .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: The same is true of Kerr Smith whose character had even less dimensionality .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: On the awful side , there were Daniel Robuck and Roger Guenveur Smith as the hapless FBI agents and Tony Todd as the completely implausible undertaker .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: This was an entertaining film and a terrific story concept .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: I rated it an 8/10 .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: It is a must - see for horror fans , but still enjoyable for a broader audience .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: Few films of this genre have the potential to improve in the sequel .

title: A fresh and entertaining approach to horror
review: This may be one of them .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: ` Final Destination " is a fairly creepy , moderately entertaining little horror film dedicated to the proposition that , although one may not be able to exactly ` cheat " death , one may be able to beat it on its own terms fair and square provided one can figure out the rules that is .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: The movie begins as a group of forty high school students and three of their teachers board a plane departing from JFK on a field trip to Paris .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: Immediately before takeoff , one student receives a premonition that the plane will explode moments after becoming airborne , a vision that manages to get himself and several other passengers safely off before the inevitable occurs .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: But as Alex and his fellow survivors soon discover , Death is not to be avoided quite so easily , as each becomes the target of a systematic plan of elimination .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: If the details of the initial premise sound familiar , it is probably because they match almost perfectly those surrounding the downing of Flight 103 back in 1996 .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: Waving aside questions of taste and propriety is it really right to use the details of a real life tragedy as fodder for a silly little horror flick ? Let us concede that ` Final Destination " taps into some pretty basic fears about the uncertain , random and arbitrary nature of Death .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: The idea itself is enough to make us all stop

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: and ponder the truth of our mortality and the truly tenuous thread by which we daily cling to this thing we call life .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: But like so many horror films in the modern era , the premise is better than the execution .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: The various deaths depicted herein become so choreographed and preposterous in their details that they actually end up diluting some of their own ability to disturb and terrify .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: Indeed , the more elaborate and high tech the death scenes become , the less creepy they seem .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: We become bemused and detached when we should be cringing and empathetic .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: Death simply has to work too hard in some of these scenes

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: and the strain shows .

title: imaginative thriller that overdoses on special effects
review: Thus , for all its originality of premise , the film , by making Death seem like nothing more disturbing than a conventional special effects showoff , robs Man"s greatest enemy of his awe - inspiring and overwhelming power and sting !

title: Final Destination
review: " In death there are no accidents , no coincidences , no mishaps , and no escapes ! " , from one of the creators of The X Files , James Wong , this is a really clever scary movie .

title: Final Destination
review: Basically Alex Browning ( Devon Sawa ) and his class are getting on a plane for a field trip to Paris , France ,

title: Final Destination
review: but before the journey has even begun he is having weird thoughts , and ultimately he has a horrific premonition of the plane exploding on take off .

title: Final Destination
review: He and a few of the other passengers are taken off the plane because of his panic ,

title: Final Destination
review: and then everyone is shocked when it turns out that the plane does indeed explode .

title: Final Destination
review: But this is only the beginning of the nightmare , as after the funeral at the school , where the survivors pay tribute to those who died , the strange events take place .

title: Final Destination
review: Tod Waggner ( Chad E. Donella ) is the first victim of a series of bizarre " accidents " , as he slips on water

title: Final Destination
review: and is strangled to death by the wall wire in the bath full of slippery products .

title: Final Destination
review: Alex and his close friend Clear Rivers ( Ali Larter ) , who got off the plane because she believed his premonition was true , they go to see Tod"s body ,

title: Final Destination
review: and the mysterious mortician William Bludworth ( Candyman"s Tony Todd ) gives them seemingly insightful knowledge about how Death ( The Grim Reaper ) works .

title: Final Destination
review: They conclude that Death is stalking them until all the survivors of Flight 180 are dead , unless they can find a way to cheat death again ,

title: Final Destination
review: and at that point they witness Terry Chaney ( Amanda Detmer ) suddenly hit by a bus .

title: Final Destination
review: Alex works out the order that they were meant to die on the plane from his premonition and from the news giving detail about the direction of the explosion ,

title: Final Destination
review: and he works out that teacher Ms. Valerie Lewton ( Kristen Cloke ) is next ,

title: Final Destination
review: but he is too late to save her from getting computer glass in her neck , a knife in her chest and dying in an explosion .

title: Final Destination
review: The remaining survivors , Alex , Clear , Carter Horton ( Kerr Smith ) and Billy Hitchcock ( American Pie"s Seann William Scott ) know they have to stick together if they want to live ,

title: Final Destination
review: but Death will always find a way to get them again .

title: Final Destination
review: This is seen when Carter contemplates getting himself killed ,

title: Final Destination
review: and at the moment he changes his mind it looks like he won"t survive , until Alex saves , and it skips to the next victim , Billy , who gets beheaded by a piece of car shrapnel whipped by the passing train .

title: Final Destination
review: While Carter goes away knowing he is safe , Alex knows he will be next ,

title: Final Destination
review: but he manages to save himself , and then he dashes to rescue Clear who is trying to escape the various methods of death , such as glass shattering , electrocution , and an explosion , until Alex sacrifices himself .

title: Final Destination
review: Six months pass , and Alex , Clear and Carter have arrived in Paris where the class were meant to be , and they are sure they have cheated death

title: Final Destination
review: and defeated the design , until of course it comes again , and it fades to black when Carter is about to be crushed by a sign .

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: The Final Destination series ranks right down there with Hostel and The Purge as some of my least favorite popular horror franchises .

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: Unlike the other two , I have no clue why this one bothers me like it does ,

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: but something about its blend of silly cgi death scenes played completely straight and obvious attempts to appeal to a more " mainstream " ( for lack of a better word ) audience than most horror gets on my nerves .

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: The premise is rather hard to take seriously , feeling rather like a mediocre Scream knock - off a la Urban Legend or I Know What You Did Last Summer ,

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: but with the killer replaced with a series of unlikely and usually fatal mishaps .

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: Unfortunately , the film takes this silly premise too seriously ,

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: and squanders the potential for some delicious moments of black comedy .

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: This , combined with the ugly early 2000s cgi and drab sets and lighting , leads to a dull and uninvolving viewing experience .

title: Rube Goldberg presents: I Know What You Did Last Summer
review: The fact that something resembling a workplace safety video with characters and a higher budget could become so popular truly boggles the mind .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Somewhere buried deep in the film"s premise lies the kernel of an intriguing idea - and that"s Final Destination"s lone good point .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: What happens if someone on board a plane has a premonition of disaster , flees from the aircraft before takeoff , then watches in horror as it explodes once it is airborne .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Of course , it takes about ten minutes for it to become apparent that Final Destination is only going to use this as a hook .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: The point of the movie has nothing to do with how the survivors cope with guilt and uncertainty .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Instead , Final Destination is intent upon illustrating that , while it"s possible for seven people to cheat death by disembarking from a doomed plane , the Devil still demands his due .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: So , with John Denver singing in the background , they start dying one - by - one .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Even the special effects are no good .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Near the beginning of the film , as Sawa"s character , Alex , has a vision of the plane"s destruction , we are treated to the same kind of visuals used several decades ago when Christopher Reeve"s Superman took to the air .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Later , for a beheading scene , the decapitation is so ineptly done that I found myself choking back laughter .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Moments like that make you wonder if this film could have had a chance as camp .

title: Campy fun, if that
review: Unfortunately , the somber , serious tone deflates any hope of this .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Once in a while a film comes along that you have no hopes for ,

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: but which pleasantly surprises you anyway .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: And into the over - saturated market of the teen flick comes FINAL DESTINATION , a dizzying and suspenseful shocker which has to be the best teen horror film we"ve had since SCREAM - all right , I know that"s not saying much , but watch this anyway .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Tired viewers will be glad to hear that this teen - orientated film isn"t full of moronic dialogue and boring situations set in a school - instead , the film is focused entirely on the central premise , there is no deviation .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Created by the two guys who made THE X - FILES so interesting when it first started - James Wong and Glen Morgan - this is , at last , an original film .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: There is no bogeyman here , no masked slasher , instead the killer is fate itself .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: I"d give my right arm for a little bit of originality these days , which is why this film enthralled me so much .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: The film starts off excellently with a strong sense of impending doom and a horrific to watch plane explosion .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: It then slows down only to pick up the pace in the second half , becoming both exciting and thrilling .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Of course , it"s the deaths which are the highlights of the film ,

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: and these definitely do not disappoint .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Inbetween them , we get some typical teen angst as the shunned Sawa tries to convince his friends that they"re about to die .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Sawa , who starred in horror comedy IDLE HANDS , is surprisingly good in the lead role , giving us a likable neurotic who manages to be heroic when the time comes .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Okay , so the rest of the cast are merely passable - full of the beautiful but bland faces populating most American soap operas these days -

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: but it"s nice to see Tony Todd pop up in a cameo as a creepy morgue attendant who gets all the best lines .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: As I mentioned before , the death scenes are outstanding , yes , FANTASTIC ; they consist of a series of commonplace accidents which culminate in the victim"s demise .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: They"re grisly and surprisingly gory in places , making a nice change these days from relatively bloodless stuff like I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: Okay , so the fiery , frenetic climax is a bit predictable

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: but there"s a nice twist at the very end .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: FINAL DESTINATION is a clever film ,

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: and one to be watched .

title: Uniquely entertaining
review: It has a uniqueness about it which sets it above the rest and it"s thoroughly enjoyable too - what more can be said ?
