title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Final Destination can safely be described as a " teen horror " largely peopled by and clearly aimed at teenagers .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: The plot , such as it is , concerns Alex Browning ( played by Devon Sawa ) who is preparing for a school trip to Paris , France .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: His premonition of imminent disaster leads to him and several other characters leaving the subsequently doomed flight .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: However , " Death " will not be cheated so easily ... The first act of this film leading up to and including the destruction of Flight 180 leads us to believe that we are watching a horror film with serious intent .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Whilst there are comic vignettes being played out in typical teen fashion there is an underlying build up of tension .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Unfortunately for this viewer at least , as soon as the characters are delineated

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: and plot development clearly laid out , any serious intent is drowned out by an over - clever reliance on the formulaic filmmaking which has become the norm with this genre .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Lead - or rather , " stock " - characters other than our hero include the obligatory quirky girl Clear Rivers ( Ali Larter ) , tough guy Carter Horton ( Kerr Smith chewing up the scenery ) , his trampish girl Terry Chaney ( Amanda Detmer ) , the hero"s best friend Tod Waggner ( Chad Donella ) , Billy Hitchcock ( Sean William Scott ) and teacher Valerie Lewton ( Kristen Cloke ) .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: We can gain virtually no satisfaction at this point in working out the survival rate and the order of demise .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Minor , yet somehow more interesting roles are given to Tony Todd as mortician Bludworth ( a wasted part seemingly used simply to explain what is going on ) ,

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: and Daniel Roebuck alongside Roger Guenveur Smith as FBI Agents Weine and Schreck respectively , nicely bouncing off each other .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Death"s modus operandi veers between extremely complicated with lots of red herrings along the way ( Tod"s suicidal tendencies giving way to an eventual accidental hanging ; Mrs. Lewton and a bizarre combination of steam , gas , electricity , alcohol , fire and kitchen knives ) , to the dramatic take - your - breath away split - second splattering moment ( both Terry and Billy ) .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Unfortunately this is not enough to sustain our interest for what seems an overlong hour and a half .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Clunky dialogue , predictable turns ( particularly the " twist " ending ) and a story that ( despite other reviewers - probably much younger than myself - claiming otherwise)is hardly original in concept leaves us with a finished product which whilst not being " bad " simply does not rise above the dross that makes up the vast majority of this genre .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: For this we have to blame director and co - writer James Wong along with his writing cohorts Glen Morgan and Jeffrey Reddick .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: The overuse of foreshadowing along with too many visual references - " 180 " pops up again and again which would be fine if the film were released under the working title of Flight 180 - in - jokes like naming characters after famous horror stars and directors ;

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: and an obsession with people sitting on toilet seats all indicate the fun the makers were having .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: All of which simply detracts from the point of the exercise .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Background music courtesy of Adam Hamilton and Shirley Walker could best be described as a cross between forgettable and bland but fortunately remains firmly in the background .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: The estimated budget for this film was $ 23 million , most of which , judging by the credits , went on special effects which were actually fairly impressive .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Unfortunately special effects alone seldom make great movies .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: Up to this time , this film has spawned three sequels and a prequel .

title: First Final, Forgettable,Four Following?
review: It is to be hoped by this reviewer at least , that they are improvements on the original ...

title: Makes you think!
review: FINAL DESTINATION was a pleasantly surprising flick when I first saw it not long after it came out

title: Makes you think!
review: and it still keeps me interested .

title: Makes you think!
review: Of course , you"d think a film with horrific deaths

title: Makes you think!
review: and populated mostly by teenagers would be a mindless slasher flick ,

title: Makes you think!
review: but this is , frankly , not .

title: Makes you think!
review: The film draws you in immediately as it postulates that " Death " has a plan .

title: Makes you think!
review: It gives clues to the the film"s protagonist Alex Browning ( excellently played by Devon Sawa ) at the outset .

title: Makes you think!
review: Alex is scheduled to go on Flight 180 to France on a trip with his fellow senior students and their chaperones , including Miss Lewton ( effective Kristen Cloke of SPACE : ABOVE AND BEYOND ) .

title: Makes you think!
review: Fellow students include the shy Clear ( sexy Ali Larter of HEROES ) .

title: Makes you think!
review: Clear is an orphan whose parents died in a tragic accident

title: Makes you think!
review: and she has a strange emotional connection to Alex , even though they had never spoken before the trip .

title: Makes you think!
review: Also there is the abrasive Carter ( menacing Kerr Smith of DAWSON"S CREEK ) , Alex"s best friend Tod ( Chad Donella ) , Carter"s girlfriend Terry ( Amanda Detmer ) , and the goofy Billy ( comic relief Sean William Scott of American PIE fame ) .

title: Makes you think!
review: Alex has a premonition that the flight will crash and in the ensuing melee and confusion , Alex , Miss Lewton , Clear , Carter , Tod , Terry , and Billy all end up off the plane

title: Makes you think!
review: and have to take a later flight .

title: Makes you think!
review: When the plane does indeed explode and crash , everyone realizes that Alex was right ! What"s really interesting is that Alex is not really looked upon as a hero ,

title: Makes you think!
review: but rather as a spooky freak ! There are varying levels of relief , curiosity , and fear exuded by all the characters after this incident

title: Makes you think!
review: and it is the fact that the plot went in this direction that makes FINAL DESTINATION a rather fascinating film .

title: Makes you think!
review: In the ensuing months , each character , still spooked out by the crash , avoids Alex , except for Clear , who is drawn to him in an almost psychic way .

title: Makes you think!
review: I find Alex and Clear coming together rather touching

title: Makes you think!
review: and it is not done in a predictable , maudlin way .

title: Makes you think!
review: They simply have a strong bond , a connection .

title: Makes you think!
review: One by one , the plane survivors begin to die rather gruesome , mysterious deaths as " Death " indeed does seem to have intended them to die , so Alex sets out to try to cheat " Death " ! That"s what is really scary about this film : Instead of the killer being a physical being , it is " Death " itself ! How do you control it ? How do you stop the ultimate killer ? While this film could have devolved into parody or inanity , it never does .

title: Makes you think!
review: The dialogue is very good and the performances uniformly exceptional .

title: Makes you think!
review: Character actors Daniel Roebuck and Roger Smith ( as federal agents investigating the mysterious crash and Alex"s story ) also do a fine job of making the film work .

title: Makes you think!
review: Veteran actor Tony Todd ( CANDYMAN ) also deserves praise for his spooky performance as a caretaker that Alex and Clear go to for help on how to cheat death .

title: Makes you think!
review: A very provocative film .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: * * SPOILER ALERT * * When 17 year old high school student Alex Browning , Devon Sawa , gets a sudden premonition of being killed , together with passengers and crew , on flight 180 from NY to Paris his actions leads to some of his fellow passengers to bolt from the plane in feeling that he may well be on to something .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: As fate would have it flight 180 explodes , just like Alex predicted ,

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: and crashes in flames in the Atlantic Ocean just minutes after it took off ! It"s later that Alex realizes that somehow he and those who left the plane with him cheated death"s grand plan that it had in store for them on flight 180 .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: With the exception of Terry ( Amanda Detmer ) , one of these who left flight 180 before it took off , the rest of those survivors who were later killed died in a number of complicated Rube Goldburg - like scenarios that took as much as five minutes to finally snuff them out .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: Alex somehow figures out , by watching the news of the plane crash on TV , the path of the explosion on the plane that hit the very seats that he and the other survivors of the plane crash were assigned to !

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: And with that Alex could now predict , by the sequence of who"s seat on the plane the fireball first hit , who"ll among those who survived will be the next persons to die .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: This of course has everyone , including the local police and FBI , feel that Alex was somehow responsible for the taking down of flight 180 ! But just how he could have known that the plane was going to crash is anyone"s guess ! Was it sabotage ? Was it that Alex knew that there was a bomb planted on the plane by terrorists ? Or the most obvious explanation , and at the same time least scientific , is it that Alex could really see into the future

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: and thus saw what was going to happen to flight 180 far , like 10 minutes , in advance ! * * * SPOILERS * * * The film starts to get a bit off base even in its storyline in the sequences of those who are to be killed , according to the explosion pattern on the doomed plane , that you get lost watching it .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: Alex for all his proved paranormal powers is totally ineffective in convincing anyone of those targeted by death - until it"s almost too ate - that the end for them is going to come and come real soon .

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: Pretty good horror / thriller even though it"s , seeing one"s death in the future , been done dozens of times before

title: It doesn't matter who's next! Because were all on the same list!
review: but never with - the mind - boggling death scenes - the ingenuity that"s in it !

The movie circles around Alex Browning , a teen going to Paris with his classmates , but he has a premonition of a deadly explosion in mid - air , he decides to get off , forcing six of his peers off .

review: The film gave me goosebumps and kept me interested throughout .

title: A Standout for it's Genre.
review: Although some questions where left unanswered , the film still kept me on the edge of my seat .

title: A Standout for it's Genre.
review: So if your looking for suspenseful thrills and inventive deaths , Final Destination is the ticket for you ! ! ! 9/10

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: The best horror films exploit simple fears ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: and since no sane person isn"t at least a little bit afraid of flying , Final Destination chooses a brilliant catalyst for its mirth .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: But a set - up isn"t enough to carry a film on its own , and the reason Final Destination works so well is that the film - makers don"t rely on their fantastic concept to push the movie .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: In less - capable hands , this story would have been a rote 10 Little Indians kill cycle ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: but by integrating genuine suspense and boundless creativity into the proceedings , Final Destination falls somewhere much closer to the category of modern classic .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: Without recounting the plot , the core premise here is that no one can cheat death ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: and that by challenging fate , we oppose powers far beyond our control or understanding .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: The " survivors " who get off of doomed Flight 180 are perfect essays for the range of human reactions to the inevitability of death .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: Some leave the plane in a panic , like those among us who fear death to the extent that we let this fear lead us through our lives and out of situations that may contribute to whatever nasty end we imagine is in store for us .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: Much more interesting , the others who disembark the jet before its inevitable destruction are led away from their fate by simple twists of chance , each with a series of minor actions that test the fabric of fate just enough to forge their unnatural survival of an event they were destined to perish in .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: This complex but identifiable crux is why Final Destination is such a masterfully - rendered work of horror .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: We"ve all had those moments in our life where a seemingly random series of events culminates in a significant occurrence .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: It"s quite natural to question what forces are at work in these instances ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: and how many variables were required to lead us to the conclusion we face .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: According to Final Destination , the force at work here is Death , itself .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: And this Death is a relentless shadow that uses pure elements like water and fire ( again , simple fears ) to create extravagant macabre Rube Goldberg devices to carry out its task .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: The way each individual piece of these machinations relates to something most of us would consider mundane ( a leaky water line , a crack in a glass ) heightens the powerful horror that permeates the film .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: After all , these victims aren"t doing things we would never do and creating their demises by irresponsible actions ; they are in situations that could actually happen to us ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: and the brilliantly slow and suspenseful set - ups that accompany each death force us to question : would WE notice the dripping water that eventually leads to our death ? The scenes in the airport at the beginning of the film are particularly gripping .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: The dread is built though a series of subtle images that don"t look at all out of place in the airport ( the departure board , the words " final destination " on the ticket ) , yet something about them is askew ( note that the number on the luggage cart that drives beneath the plane as the characters board is " 666 " , for instance ) .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: This series of little coincidences are all things that many of us would never pay attention to , or even notice to begin with ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: but if we saw them all as our main character does , could we draw any other conclusion than the one he realizes ? Of course , there is also a lot to be said for the gleefully orchestrated carnage that keeps the pulse of the film steadily pumping .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: The plane crash is a truly shocking set - piece ; chances are , no one reading this has been in one , but seeing it unfold on this screen , we get the sense that not only could the film - makers " scenario happen , it would probably happen EXACTLY like we see it here .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: Even knowing what"s coming doesn"t prepare the viewer for some of the more carefully - plotted " gotcha " moments .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: ( If you aren"t caught off guard by the bus hit , I"m guessing you have the same semi - psychic sense that drives our main character to get off the plane to begin with ) .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: By mixing in the right amount of carnage , and making it as over the top as the story allows , the film strikes a great balance between tension and release , a tenuous and not - often - realized phenomenon that classifies most of the best horror films of all time .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: This is not a perfect film , by any means .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: FD has flaws both minor ( Clear Rivers is one of the worst film character names of all time ) and major ( the entire FBI subplot , and the wholly unrealistic actions of the two agents , which are in direct opposition to the " this could happen to you " element that makes the film so frightening ) .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: The film also takes a credibility leap when the characters start calmly discussing " finding the patterns " and " getting skipped " ( would anyone in this situation really be able to understand and articulate the phenomenon they are experiencing ? ) .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: But there"s also lot to be said for making a good old - fashioned thriller ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: and since we know that"s what we"re in store for here , it"s relatively easy to allow our analytical minds take a siesta

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: and simply enjoy how well this entire concept is brought to , ahem , life . " Simple " .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: There"s that word again .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: We keep coming back to it because the notion of simplicity is key to the film"s successful delivery .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: If the main point of the story is that Death is coming , that"s pretty simple , and still effective .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: However , the interlace of actions and reactions that construct each kill , and indeed the entire notion of Death searching for those who escaped it , is anything but simple .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: So , this entity seems simple on the surface ,

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: but is in fact a more intricately constructed web than we could possibly imagine .

title: A movie about the simple things in life... and death
review: Such is life , and such is Final Destination .

review: Director James Wong"s creepy " Final Destination " qualifies as an improbable but entertaining dead teenager movie with enough twists and turns to keep you guessing until fade - out .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: Airline authorities remove a mixed bag of high school seniors bound for France from their ill - fated jetliner at the last minute when 17 - year old Alex Browning ( Devon Sawa of " Idle Hands " ) has a premonition about their 747 blowing up after take - off .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: Valerie Lewton ( Kristen Cloke of " Stay Tuned " ) , one of the teachers riding escort , agrees to behind with these reprobates while her Parisian cohort shepherds the remainder of the class across the Atlantic Ocean .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: While airport security guards detain them in the lounge , Flight 180 ascends into the night skies and explodes into a blazing fireball , with no survivors ! Typically , any movie with a protagonist that rescues a collection of characters from certain death would win not only their undying gratitude but also their lifelong loyalty .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: " Final Destination " dispenses with such hackneyed histrionics .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: Instead , the people that Alex saved either hate his guts or have to stay away from him until their grief heals .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: Everybody but Clear Rivers ( Ali Larter of " American Outlaws " ) , a Gothic - looking gal whose dad died in a convenience store robbery and whose mom lost her marbles and abandoned her , takes a shine to the ostracized Alex .

title: Tongue In Shriek Fun!!!
review: She knows that Alex has a gift for predicting the future , rather like Christopher Walken did in David Cronenberg"s " The Dead Zone " ( 1983 ) .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: " Final Destination " is a horror movie that you can"t help but love - while it might not be the scariest out there , it"s originality and creative deaths make it great .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The film starts off with a teenage senior named Alex ( Devon Sawa ) who is heading out on a field trip to Paris , France with his senior classmates .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: Afraid of flying to begin with , he is a little nervous .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: But after boarding the plane , he has a premonition of a horrible plane crash that kills himself and everyone onboard .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: Awaking from the dreamlike vision , he abruptly gets off of the plane , causing a scene , with a handful of other students and one of the teachers following .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: When the plane takes off , sure enough , it does explode , killing all onboard .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: But after the horrible accidents , those who survived ( thanks to Alex"s premonition ) begin to die bizarre deaths .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: A loner named Clear ( Ali Larter ) , who was among those who left the plane , teams together with Alex while they uncover that it just may be Death itself that has a " plan " .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: And if the plan is intruded , those who cheated death are going to pay the consequences .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: This film deserves a 10 alone just for the complete originality of it"s story .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: I"ve never seen another film of this subject matter ,

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: and it"s quite interesting how the film plays out .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: I think it"s a great idea for a horror movie , unique and original .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The entire personification of " death " scenario is an interesting thing to play with .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The plane - crash premonition was intense ,

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: and since I"m terrified of flying anyway , it made me pretty uneasy .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The deaths that follow throughout the film are quick , sometimes unexpected , and genuinely shocking .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: Some of the deaths are anticipated , you know it"s going to happen , which is quite suspenseful .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: But some of the others caught me completely off - guard , they were so abrupt and unexpected that I was nearly speechless .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The actors here were great , Devon Sawa fit the leading role as our hero who is trying to save all of his classmates as Death begins to pick them off .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: Ali Larter ( from the " House on Haunted Hill " remake ) plays his helpful sidekick , Clear , very well .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The rest of the cast all did good jobs ,

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: and we even got a cameo from Tony Todd ( of the " Candyman " series ) as a mortician who Alex and Clear run into one night .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: The ending to film was clever and left it open - ended for the sequels that followed , which were both well - done but not quite as good as the original .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: Overall , " Final Destination " is an excellent horror movie .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: It"s not really scary ,

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: but it has one of the most original stories among recent horror films , and the creative deaths and inventive sequences that take place make it all the more better .

title: Surprisingly Original Concept.
review: Surely worth a look for horror and thriller fans alike . 9/10 .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Of the teen horror movies which appeared in the nineties most were dumb gore fests with cheap shocks and a sexy , young cast .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: However , there were 2 stand outs : Scream , of course , and Final Destination .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Both are intelligent , with involving story lines , good characters , genuine shocks , and grisly deaths .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: While Scream was full of parodies and self - referential stuff , Final Destination played on our fear of death- the one thing which we all can not avoid .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: While it does make jokes about itself and its genre , they are fewer than Scream ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and do not go as over the top as some other films .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The director fills every scene with real tension and fear ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and successfully combines this with excellent set pieces and stunts , as well as sustaining a brilliant story .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: There are few films that can do this so we should admire Final Destination .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: 128 students are planning to travel to France with their teachers for one last big school trip .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: However , the plane crashes , killing everyone on board .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: We then flash back and realise that it was the premonition of one of the students , Alex .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: He has been having a strange day ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and when he sees that his premonition is coming true he tries to get everyone off the plane .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Like a certain Twilight Zone episode he succeeds in only causing a minor panic and some embarrassment , and is thrown off the plane together with a few others who got involved .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: As they wait in the airport Alex relates what he saw

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and of course no one believes him .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Suddenly the plane explodes , his premonition came true .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: In the aftermath , some of the survivors mourn , others see it as a second chance , the cops become interested in how Alex knew what was going to happen ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and Alex has further visions .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Soon the survivors are killed in bizarre ways ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and the cops believe it is Alex .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Alex thinks that death is stalking them because they cheated it ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and he works out the order that they will die in , believing that if they can catch the visions

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and prevent themselves from dying again , they will be safe .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: This will not be easy though , as death can ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and does strike from everywhere .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The idea behind the story is excellent ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and it is stylishly and effectively executed .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: It will appeal to the teen audience it is aimed at , but also older viewers as it is a very thought - provoking , existential film .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: This may sound a bit extreme ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but apart from going back to watch Bergman movies , this is the perfect film .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: One character , Carter believes he is in control of his own life , not some invisible force ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and at one point tries to prove this by parking on train tracks in front of an approaching train .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Alex becomes increasingly paranoid , hiding in a hut from death , safe - proofing it in every way he can .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Clear tries to be strong , has learnt to be this way through a tough childhood and can not believe that all life is is a series of days avoiding death .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The other survivors all have their individuality ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and are not pastiches of other characters from teen movies .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: As well as this , the performances are each outstanding , even from Sean William Scott who proves he is more than capable of being Stiffler forever .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The side plot of the cops believing Alex is behind the deaths adds a depth which most teen horror films do not have .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Wong"s direction is very stylish , and the deaths and set pieces are some of the most innovative ever , recalling the style of Argento , that everything is a potential killer .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: He also creates a massive amount of tension throughout , peaking with each death- the train and car scene will get the most flabby heart racing , the teacher in the kitchen is brilliantly staged within every fork and implement seeming deadly .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The opening 15 minutes have to be among the most tense and exciting 15 minutes in movie history , confirming all those with a fear of flying to stay firmly on the ground .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Though as you will see , the ground is far from safe .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The film shows how we are not immortal ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: and without the humorous moments it might become too much .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: There are many famous shock moments , the bus scene being the best .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Many have complained about this being stupid and unrealistic ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but if death was stalking you , of course it would try to put the approaching bus under a veil of silence .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: It is beyond understanding that anyone could rate this a 1 ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but we can see why people may not like it .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: The premise may seem too far - fetched for people ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but they seem to have forgotten that it is a fictitious horror film .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Death here as a character does have a sense of humour , each death being ironic , gruesome or made to look like an accident ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but this is all the more terrifying , that this force is coming after us for entertainment .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Death wants immediate pay back for those who cheated it ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but in the style of a Bond villain , likes to play with its victims first .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Of course the deaths may seem impossible in the real world ,

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: but if it is Death stalking us , I think it has the power to bend a few rules .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: Most criticism of this film is petty and unexplained , meaning that the scoring of zero can not be justified .

title: Quick Reviews!!
review: For clever , shocking , exciting teen horror movies , there are very few better than this . 9 out of 10

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: POSSIBLE SPOILERS ( UNLIKELY , Though ) Wong"s film is a real challenge for all of us that want to find out a second earlier at least what"s there ahead of us , waiting ... One thing is for sure : you can not cheat death , nor predict what"s next ( remember what Master Yoda stated : " Always in motion is the future " ) .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: Briefly , the story goes like this : having a vision of his plane to Paris crashing in flames , Chance Browning gets off , all sweaty , together with several of his fellows and a teacher .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: The vision gets real and everyone looks at him suspiciously .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: What they don"t realize now is that they were meant to be on that plane and die .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: Which they will soon do , because Death has something else in store for them

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: and this is definitely not survival .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: Extremely well - defined atmosphere ( watch out for the anticipations in the opening credits ) , increasing tension , good acting and brilliant style in editing .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: Wong pays homage in a very interesting way to great horror movies history figures , naming his characters Browning , Waggner , Lewton a. S. O. Some viewers may not handle several horrific deaths ( Tod"s strangulation , for instance - by the way , " Tod " means " death " in German , how ironical ! ) for which goosebumps are guaranteed .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: Anyway , " Final Destination " is a film NOT to be missed because it deals in fact with the raw stuff of our innermost expectances and fears .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: I give it 81/2 out of 10 .

title: Why do you want to know what's coming?
review: Don"t startle at the very end !

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: He"s the Russian - born producer / director who changed his name to " Val Lewton .

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: " His first claim to fame was the original 1942 version of " the Cat People .

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: " His second claim to fame was his often - paraphrased belief about what scares people more .

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: He felt it was the stuff they DON"T see !

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: And , this movie lives up to that philosophy .

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: Why , even the lead actress"character is named " Valerie Lewton ! " Plus , there was enough box - office success that a not - too - bad sequel resulted .

title: VLADIMIR LEVENTON WOULD'VE BEEN PROUD!
review: * Does that revelation count as a spoiler ? * Final analysis ? If a few more horror - flick producers and directors followed that philosophy , they wouldn"t have mega - flops like the Liam Neeson remake of " The Haunting " coming back to haunt their resumes " ! Personal rating ? 3 . 9 stars

review: I sat down to this movie , fearing it would fail ( like many of its predecessors ) .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: Was I ever wrong ! Alex , a high school senior , has a premonition that the plane carrying his class to Paris will never reach its final destination .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: As aspects of this premonition begin to come true , Alex freaks out - landing a teacher & some other students a one - way ticket off the plane .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: The plane blows up right after take - off , sending all on board to their final destination .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: Death , furious that his " design " was cheated , pursues the survivors in the order they were intended to die .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: It is now up to Alex , who continues to forsee Death coming , to save his classmates & teacher .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: Unfortunately , nobody believes him ( cliche ,

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: but works beautifully here ) .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: One of the best elements of the film is the subtlety of Death .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: He does not stalk his victims with flesh - and - blood body ,

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: but through wind & shadow .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: The tools of his destruction are calculated & precise , using everyday items .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!
review: Never before have I seen a killer so cunning .

title: A Most Excellent Horror/Thriller!

review: A party of US smalltown high school kids are setting off for a trip to France when Alex ( Devon Sawa ) has a sudden , fearful premonition that their aircraft is about to explode on take - off ( be warned , nervous fliers , this is probably the most chilling crash sequence since Alive ) .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: While aboard a plane with a handful of his fellow students , Alex suddenly predicts that the airplane explodes .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: Only Alex , his friend , Tod ( Chad Donella ) , Carter Horton ( Kerr Smith ) , Terry Chaney ( Amanda Detmer ) , Clear Rivers ( Ali Larter ) , Billy Hitchcock ( Seann William Scott ) and teacher , Ms. Valarie Lewton ( Kristen Cloke ) are the only survivors from the school feild trip .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: One by one , since the plane crash , each survivor has died tragically .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: The only way to save their lives is to cheat death itself .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: Freaky .... Isn"t it ? :) FINALLY ! A teenage horror flick that doesn"t involve some goofy dude dressed up in a stupid costume , going around killing people like they had in " Scream " , " Urban Legend " , etc .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: Something that involves the mysterious supernatural , and involves even more heart pounding adventure ! :) Also , the foreshadowing is very clear in the flick with the John Denver tunes and the dark shadows that lurk from behind them .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: Interesting graphics and effects make this film an excellent flick ! :) If you happen to watch the DVD version of the movie , you will also get to watch some deleted scenes to the movie , which I found interesting .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: Also , an alternate ending to the whole film .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: Personally , I liked the alternate ending much better than the one they had on the film itself .

title: Something Different That Defines A Teen Thriller Flick
review: But oh well ! Overall , " Final Destination " is a great film ! You would not want to miss this one ! :)

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!
review: Yes , there are plenty of plot holes in this movie , yes it´s another teen slasher , yes the ending has to much special effects and no decent plot .

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!
review: and not so badly developed as it looks , the usual " teen - clichés " never get over the story just to fill screen time , there are no f@#%-up dudes slashing teens with knifes , the deaths are original although by the end they got totally predictable ( this is a Hollywood teen flic after all ) , the movie sometimes can get very uncomfortable because it has a brilliant dark creepy atmosphere ,

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!
review: and despite all the shallow action and plot dumbness FINAL DESTINATION , still can put people talking about its theme . Death and destiny .

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!
review: Because in the middle of all that sometimes Hollywood mess , this story still raises interesting questions .

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!
review: SCREAM didn´t do that at all , because couldn´t care less about the plot , we just wanted to see the next babe getting slashed .

title: WE´RE ALL GONNA DIE !!!!
review: So in my opinion FINAL DESTINATION , is the best teen - movie around , altohugh i think it´s unfair to classify it like that , because despite all the flaws this still is a more intelligent movie than all the rest .

title: Come Fly the Deadly Skies
review: Oh I was pleased to say the least that those bozos in Hollywood who have milked every last cent from us and shown us nothing but obligatory booby - shirt shots of Jennifer Love Hewitt , finally created a film under the same genre that challenged us as the audience to think ! Final Destination was such a relief because there has not been an impressive horror movie made in these latter years since Scream in 1996 .
